trans-unit.source: The <token>azure_2</token> web role is a role that is customized for web application programming as supported by IIS 7, such as ASP.NET, PHP, Windows Communication Foundation, and FastCGI.
trans-unit.target: The <token>azure_2</token> web role is a role that is customized for web application programming as supported by IIS 7, such as ASP.NET, PHP, Windows Communication Foundation, and FastCGI.

trans-unit.source: The default extension for the service definition file is .csdef.
trans-unit.target: The default extension for the service definition file is .csdef.

trans-unit.source: Basic service definition schema for a web role
trans-unit.target: Basic service definition schema for a web role

trans-unit.source: The basic format of a service definition file containing a web role is as follows.
trans-unit.target: The basic format of a service definition file containing a web role is as follows.

trans-unit.source: The service definition file includes these elements, described in detail in subsequent sections in this topic:
trans-unit.target: The service definition file includes these elements, described in detail in subsequent sections in this topic:

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>WebRole</languageKeyword> element describes a role that is customized for web application programming, as supported by IIS 7 and ASP.NET.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>WebRole</languageKeyword> element describes a role that is customized for web application programming, as supported by IIS 7 and ASP.NET.

trans-unit.source: A service may contain zero or more web roles.
trans-unit.target: A service may contain zero or more web roles.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>WebRole</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>WebRole</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The name for the web role.
trans-unit.target: The name for the web role.

trans-unit.source: The role's name must be unique.
trans-unit.target: The role's name must be unique.

trans-unit.source: The default value is <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>; native code execution and full trust are enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: The default value is <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>; native code execution and full trust are enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: Set this attribute to <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword> to disable native code execution for the web role, and use Azure partial trust instead.
trans-unit.target: Set this attribute to <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword> to disable native code execution for the web role, and use Azure partial trust instead.

trans-unit.source: Set this value to change the size of the virtual machine that is allotted to the role.
trans-unit.target: Set this value to change the size of the virtual machine that is allotted to the role.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="24049f9e-c88c-439e-bff7-2430840fc08c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="24049f9e-c88c-439e-bff7-2430840fc08c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>ConfigurationSettings</languageKeyword> element describes the collection of configuration settings for a web role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>ConfigurationSettings</languageKeyword> element describes the collection of configuration settings for a web role.

trans-unit.source: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Setting</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Setting</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Setting</languageKeyword> element describes a name and value pair that specifies a configuration setting for an instance of a role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Setting</languageKeyword> element describes a name and value pair that specifies a configuration setting for an instance of a role.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Setting</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Setting</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: A unique name for the configuration setting.
trans-unit.target: A unique name for the configuration setting.

trans-unit.source: The configuration settings for a role are name and value pairs that are declared in the service definition file and set in the service configuration file.
trans-unit.target: The configuration settings for a role are name and value pairs that are declared in the service definition file and set in the service configuration file.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>LocalResources</languageKeyword> element describes the collection of local storage resources for a web role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>LocalResources</languageKeyword> element describes the collection of local storage resources for a web role.

trans-unit.source: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>LocalStorage</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>LocalStorage</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>LocalStorage</languageKeyword> element identifies a local storage resource that provides file system space for the service at runtime.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>LocalStorage</languageKeyword> element identifies a local storage resource that provides file system space for the service at runtime.

trans-unit.source: A role may define zero or more local storage resources.
trans-unit.target: A role may define zero or more local storage resources.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>LocalStorage</languageKeyword> element can appear as a child of the <languageKeyword>WebRole</languageKeyword> element to support compatibility with earlier versions of the Azure SDK.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>LocalStorage</languageKeyword> element can appear as a child of the <languageKeyword>WebRole</languageKeyword> element to support compatibility with earlier versions of the Azure SDK.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>LocalStorage</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>LocalStorage</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: A unique name for the local store.
trans-unit.target: A unique name for the local store.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the local store should be cleaned when the role is restarted.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the local store should be cleaned when the role is restarted.

trans-unit.source: The desired amount of storage space to allocate for the local store, in MB.
trans-unit.target: The desired amount of storage space to allocate for the local store, in MB.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, the default storage space allocated is 100 MB.
trans-unit.target: If not specified, the default storage space allocated is 100 MB.

trans-unit.source: The minimum amount of storage space that may be allocated is 1 MB.
trans-unit.target: The minimum amount of storage space that may be allocated is 1 MB.

trans-unit.source: The maximum size of the local resources is dependent on the virtual machine size.
trans-unit.target: The maximum size of the local resources is dependent on the virtual machine size.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="24049f9e-c88c-439e-bff7-2430840fc08c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="24049f9e-c88c-439e-bff7-2430840fc08c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: The name of the directory allocated to the local storage resource corresponds to the value provided for the name attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the directory allocated to the local storage resource corresponds to the value provided for the name attribute.

trans-unit.source: For more information on accessing a local storage resource from code running within a role instance, see <legacyLink xlink:href="95b332bf-5076-4b1e-897e-7fb7226aed1b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure Local Storage Resources</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on accessing a local storage resource from code running within a role instance, see <legacyLink xlink:href="95b332bf-5076-4b1e-897e-7fb7226aed1b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure Local Storage Resources</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Endpoints</languageKeyword> element describes the collection of input (external), internal, and instance input endpoints for a role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Endpoints</languageKeyword> element describes the collection of input (external), internal, and instance input endpoints for a role.

trans-unit.source: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>InputEndpoint</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>InternalEndpoint</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>InstanceInputEndpoint</languageKeyword> elements.
trans-unit.target: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>InputEndpoint</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>InternalEndpoint</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>InstanceInputEndpoint</languageKeyword> elements.

trans-unit.source: Input and Internal endpoints are allocated separately.
trans-unit.target: Input and Internal endpoints are allocated separately.

trans-unit.source: A service can have a total of 25 input, internal, and instance input endpoints which can be allocated across the 25 roles allowed in a service.
trans-unit.target: A service can have a total of 25 input, internal, and instance input endpoints which can be allocated across the 25 roles allowed in a service.

trans-unit.source: For example, if have 5 roles you can allocate 5 input endpoints per role or you can allocate 25 input endpoints to a single role or you can allocate 1 input endpoint each to 25 roles.
trans-unit.target: For example, if have 5 roles you can allocate 5 input endpoints per role or you can allocate 25 input endpoints to a single role or you can allocate 1 input endpoint each to 25 roles.

trans-unit.source: Each role deployed requires one instance per role.
trans-unit.target: Each role deployed requires one instance per role.

trans-unit.source: The default provisioning for a subscription is limited to 20 cores and thus is limited to 20 instances of a role.
trans-unit.target: The default provisioning for a subscription is limited to 20 cores and thus is limited to 20 instances of a role.

trans-unit.source: If your application requires more instances than is provided by the default provisioning see <externalLink><linkText>Billing, Subscription Management and Quota Support</linkText><linkUri>http://www.microsoft.com/windowsazure/support/</linkUri></externalLink> for more information on increasing your quota.
trans-unit.target: If your application requires more instances than is provided by the default provisioning see <externalLink><linkText>Billing, Subscription Management and Quota Support</linkText><linkUri>http://www.microsoft.com/windowsazure/support/</linkUri></externalLink> for more information on increasing your quota.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>InputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element describes an external endpoint to a web role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>InputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element describes an external endpoint to a web role.

trans-unit.source: You can define multiple endpoints that are a combination of HTTP, HTTPS, UDP, and TCP endpoints.
trans-unit.target: You can define multiple endpoints that are a combination of HTTP, HTTPS, UDP, and TCP endpoints.

trans-unit.source: You can specify any port number you choose for an input endpoint, but the port numbers specified for each role in the service must be unique.
trans-unit.target: You can specify any port number you choose for an input endpoint, but the port numbers specified for each role in the service must be unique.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you specify that a web role uses port 80 for HTTP and port 443 for HTTPS, you might then specify that a second web role uses port 8080 for HTTP and port 8043 for HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you specify that a web role uses port 80 for HTTP and port 443 for HTTPS, you might then specify that a second web role uses port 8080 for HTTP and port 8043 for HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>InputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>InputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: A unique name for the external endpoint.
trans-unit.target: A unique name for the external endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The transport protocol for the external endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The transport protocol for the external endpoint.

trans-unit.source: For a web role, possible values are <languageKeyword>HTTP</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>HTTPS</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>UDP</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>TCP</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: For a web role, possible values are <languageKeyword>HTTP</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>HTTPS</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>UDP</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>TCP</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: The port for the external endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The port for the external endpoint.

trans-unit.source: You can specify any port number you choose, but the port numbers specified for each role in the service must be unique.
trans-unit.target: You can specify any port number you choose, but the port numbers specified for each role in the service must be unique.

trans-unit.source: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive (<token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher).
trans-unit.target: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive (<token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher).

trans-unit.source: The name of a certificate defined by a <languageKeyword>Certificate</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The name of a certificate defined by a <languageKeyword>Certificate</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a port used for internal connections on the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a port used for internal connections on the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>localPort</languageKeyword> attribute maps the external port on the endpoint to an internal port on a role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>localPort</languageKeyword> attribute maps the external port on the endpoint to an internal port on a role.

trans-unit.source: This is useful in scenarios where a role must communicate to an internal component on a port that different from the one that is exposed externally.
trans-unit.target: This is useful in scenarios where a role must communicate to an internal component on a port that different from the one that is exposed externally.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, the value of <languageKeyword>localPort</languageKeyword> is the same as the <languageKeyword>port</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: If not specified, the value of <languageKeyword>localPort</languageKeyword> is the same as the <languageKeyword>port</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: Set the value of <languageKeyword>localPort</languageKeyword> to “*” to automatically assign an unallocated port that is discoverable using the runtime API.
trans-unit.target: Set the value of <languageKeyword>localPort</languageKeyword> to “*” to automatically assign an unallocated port that is discoverable using the runtime API.

trans-unit.source: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive (<token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher).
trans-unit.target: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive (<token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher).

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>localPort</languageKeyword> attribute is only available using the <token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>localPort</languageKeyword> attribute is only available using the <token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: When the value of this attribute is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, the status of a service is ignored and the endpoint will not be removed by the load balancer.
trans-unit.target: When the value of this attribute is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, the status of a service is ignored and the endpoint will not be removed by the load balancer.

trans-unit.source: Setting this value to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> useful for debugging busy instances of a service.
trans-unit.target: Setting this value to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> useful for debugging busy instances of a service.

trans-unit.source: An endpoint can still receive traffic even when the role is not in a Ready state.
trans-unit.target: An endpoint can still receive traffic even when the role is not in a Ready state.

trans-unit.source: The name of the load balancer probe associated with the input endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The name of the load balancer probe associated with the input endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>InternalEndpoint</languageKeyword> element describes an internal endpoint to a web role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>InternalEndpoint</languageKeyword> element describes an internal endpoint to a web role.

trans-unit.source: An internal endpoint is available only to other role instances running within the service; it is not available to clients outside the service.
trans-unit.target: An internal endpoint is available only to other role instances running within the service; it is not available to clients outside the service.

trans-unit.source: Web roles that do not include the <languageKeyword>Sites</languageKeyword> element can only have a single HTTP, UDP, or TCP internal endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Web roles that do not include the <languageKeyword>Sites</languageKeyword> element can only have a single HTTP, UDP, or TCP internal endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>InternalEndpoint</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>InternalEndpoint</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: A unique name for the internal endpoint.
trans-unit.target: A unique name for the internal endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The transport protocol for the internal endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The transport protocol for the internal endpoint.

trans-unit.source: A value of <languageKeyword>ANY</languageKeyword> specifies that any protocol, any port is allowed.
trans-unit.target: A value of <languageKeyword>ANY</languageKeyword> specifies that any protocol, any port is allowed.

trans-unit.source: The port used for internal load balanced connections on the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The port used for internal load balanced connections on the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: A Load balanced endpoint uses two ports.
trans-unit.target: A Load balanced endpoint uses two ports.

trans-unit.source: The port used for the public IP address, and the port used on the private IP address.
trans-unit.target: The port used for the public IP address, and the port used on the private IP address.

trans-unit.source: Typically these are these are set to the same, but you can choose to use different ports.
trans-unit.target: Typically these are these are set to the same, but you can choose to use different ports.

trans-unit.source: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive (<token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher).
trans-unit.target: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive (<token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher).

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Port</languageKeyword> attribute is only available using the <token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Port</languageKeyword> attribute is only available using the <token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>InstanceInputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element describes an instance input endpoint to a web role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>InstanceInputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element describes an instance input endpoint to a web role.

trans-unit.source: An instance input endpoint is associated with a specific role instance by using port forwarding in the load balancer.
trans-unit.target: An instance input endpoint is associated with a specific role instance by using port forwarding in the load balancer.

trans-unit.source: Each instance input endpoint is mapped to a specific port from a range of possible ports.
trans-unit.target: Each instance input endpoint is mapped to a specific port from a range of possible ports.

trans-unit.source: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>AllocatePublicPortFrom</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>AllocatePublicPortFrom</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>InstanceInputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element is only available using the <token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>InstanceInputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element is only available using the <token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>InstanceInputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>InstanceInputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: A unique name for the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: A unique name for the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the internal port that all role instances will listen to in order to receive incoming traffic forwarded from the load balancer.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the internal port that all role instances will listen to in order to receive incoming traffic forwarded from the load balancer.

trans-unit.source: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive.
trans-unit.target: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive.

trans-unit.source: The transport protocol for the internal endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The transport protocol for the internal endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>AllocatePublicPortFrom</languageKeyword> element describes the public port range that can be used by external customers to access each instance input endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>AllocatePublicPortFrom</languageKeyword> element describes the public port range that can be used by external customers to access each instance input endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The public (VIP) port number is allocated from this range and assigned to each individual role instance endpoint during tenant deployment and update.
trans-unit.target: The public (VIP) port number is allocated from this range and assigned to each individual role instance endpoint during tenant deployment and update.

trans-unit.source: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>AllocatePublicPortFrom</languageKeyword> element is only available using the <token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>AllocatePublicPortFrom</languageKeyword> element is only available using the <token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>FixedPort</languageKeyword> element specifies the port for the internal endpoint, which enables load balanced connections on the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>FixedPort</languageKeyword> element specifies the port for the internal endpoint, which enables load balanced connections on the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>FixedPort</languageKeyword> element is only available using the <token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>FixedPort</languageKeyword> element is only available using the <token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>FixedPort</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>FixedPort</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The port for the internal endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The port for the internal endpoint.

trans-unit.source: This has the same effect as setting the <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> min and max to the same port.
trans-unit.target: This has the same effect as setting the <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> min and max to the same port.

trans-unit.source: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive (<token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher).
trans-unit.target: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive (<token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher).

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element specifies the range of ports that are assigned to the internal endpoint or instance input endpoint, and sets the port used for load balanced connections on the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element specifies the range of ports that are assigned to the internal endpoint or instance input endpoint, and sets the port used for load balanced connections on the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element works differently depending on the element in which it resides.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element works differently depending on the element in which it resides.

trans-unit.source: When the <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element is in the <languageKeyword>InternalEndpoint</languageKeyword> element, it opens all ports on the load balancer within the range of the min and max attributes for all virtual machines on which the role runs.
trans-unit.target: When the <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element is in the <languageKeyword>InternalEndpoint</languageKeyword> element, it opens all ports on the load balancer within the range of the min and max attributes for all virtual machines on which the role runs.

trans-unit.source: When the <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element is in the <languageKeyword>InstanceInputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element, it opens only one port within the range of the min and max attributes on each virtual machine running the role.
trans-unit.target: When the <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element is in the <languageKeyword>InstanceInputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element, it opens only one port within the range of the min and max attributes on each virtual machine running the role.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element is only available using the <token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element is only available using the <token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>FixedPortRange</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The minimum port in the range.
trans-unit.target: The minimum port in the range.

trans-unit.source: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive (<token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher).
trans-unit.target: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive (<token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher).

trans-unit.source: The maximum port in the range.
trans-unit.target: The maximum port in the range.

trans-unit.source: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive (<token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher).
trans-unit.target: Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive (<token>azure_2</token> SDK version 1.7 or higher).

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Certificates</languageKeyword> element describes the collection of certificates for a web role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Certificates</languageKeyword> element describes the collection of certificates for a web role.

trans-unit.source: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Certificate</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Certificate</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: A role may have any number of associated certificates.
trans-unit.target: A role may have any number of associated certificates.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using the certificates element, see <legacyLink xlink:href="7c35b8e3-7d17-4173-80c5-31ec33de7f50" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Associate a Certificate with a Service</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on using the certificates element, see <legacyLink xlink:href="7c35b8e3-7d17-4173-80c5-31ec33de7f50" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Associate a Certificate with a Service</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Certificate</languageKeyword> element describes a certificate that is associated with a web role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Certificate</languageKeyword> element describes a certificate that is associated with a web role.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Certificate</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Certificate</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: A name for this certificate, which is used to refer to it when it is associated with an HTTPS <languageKeyword>InputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: A name for this certificate, which is used to refer to it when it is associated with an HTTPS <languageKeyword>InputEndpoint</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The location of the certificate store where this certificate may be found on the local machine.
trans-unit.target: The location of the certificate store where this certificate may be found on the local machine.

trans-unit.source: The name of the certificate store where this certificate resides on the local machine.
trans-unit.target: The name of the certificate store where this certificate resides on the local machine.

trans-unit.source: Possible values include the built-in store names <languageKeyword>My</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Root</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>CA</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Trust</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Disallowed</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>TrustedPeople</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>TrustedPublisher</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>AuthRoot</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>AddressBook</languageKeyword>, or any custom store name.
trans-unit.target: Possible values include the built-in store names <languageKeyword>My</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Root</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>CA</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Trust</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Disallowed</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>TrustedPeople</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>TrustedPublisher</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>AuthRoot</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>AddressBook</languageKeyword>, or any custom store name.

trans-unit.source: If a custom store name is specified, the store is automatically created.
trans-unit.target: If a custom store name is specified, the store is automatically created.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the access permissions given to the role processes.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the access permissions given to the role processes.

trans-unit.source: If you want only elevated processes to be able to access the private key, then specify <languageKeyword>elevated</languageKeyword> permission.
trans-unit.target: If you want only elevated processes to be able to access the private key, then specify <languageKeyword>elevated</languageKeyword> permission.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>limitedOrElevated</languageKeyword> permission allows all role processes to access the private key.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>limitedOrElevated</languageKeyword> permission allows all role processes to access the private key.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Imports</languageKeyword> element describes a collection of import modules for a web role that add components to the guest operating system.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Imports</languageKeyword> element describes a collection of import modules for a web role that add components to the guest operating system.

trans-unit.source: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Import</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Import</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: This element is optional and a role can have only one runtime block.
trans-unit.target: This element is optional and a role can have only one runtime block.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Imports</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Imports</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Import</languageKeyword> element specifies a module to add to the guest operating system.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Import</languageKeyword> element specifies a module to add to the guest operating system.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Import</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Import</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Import</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Import</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The name of the module to import.
trans-unit.target: The name of the module to import.

trans-unit.source: The RemoteAccess and RemoteForwarder modules allow you to configure your role instance for remote desktop connections.
trans-unit.target: The RemoteAccess and RemoteForwarder modules allow you to configure your role instance for remote desktop connections.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <legacyLink xlink:href="2f4b8776-50e5-4e3d-af39-8a4754a76859" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Up a Remote Desktop Connection for a Role in Azure</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <legacyLink xlink:href="2f4b8776-50e5-4e3d-af39-8a4754a76859" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Up a Remote Desktop Connection for a Role in Azure</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: The Diagnostics module allows you to collect diagnostic data for a role instance.
trans-unit.target: The Diagnostics module allows you to collect diagnostic data for a role instance.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Runtime</languageKeyword> element describes a collection of environment variable settings for a web role that control the runtime environment of the Azure host process.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Runtime</languageKeyword> element describes a collection of environment variable settings for a web role that control the runtime environment of the Azure host process.

trans-unit.source: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Environment</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Environment</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: This element is optional and a role can have only one runtime block.
trans-unit.target: This element is optional and a role can have only one runtime block.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Runtime</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Runtime</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Runtime</languageKeyword> element:
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Runtime</languageKeyword> element:

trans-unit.source: Specifies the context in which the Role Process is launched.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the context in which the Role Process is launched.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>limited</languageKeyword> – The process is launched without Administrator privileges.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>limited</languageKeyword> – The process is launched without Administrator privileges.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>elevated</languageKeyword> – The process is launched with Administrator privileges.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>elevated</languageKeyword> – The process is launched with Administrator privileges.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Environment</languageKeyword> element describes a collection of environment variable settings for a web role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Environment</languageKeyword> element describes a collection of environment variable settings for a web role.

trans-unit.source: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Variable</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Variable</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: A role may have any number of environment variables set.
trans-unit.target: A role may have any number of environment variables set.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Variable</languageKeyword> element specifies an environment variable to set in the guest operating.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Variable</languageKeyword> element specifies an environment variable to set in the guest operating.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Variable</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Variable</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Variable</languageKeyword> element:
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Variable</languageKeyword> element:

trans-unit.source: The name of the environment variable to set.
trans-unit.target: The name of the environment variable to set.

trans-unit.source: The value to set for the environment variable.
trans-unit.target: The value to set for the environment variable.

trans-unit.source: You must include either a value attribute or a <languageKeyword>RoleInstanceValue</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: You must include either a value attribute or a <languageKeyword>RoleInstanceValue</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>RoleInstanceValue</languageKeyword> element specifies the xPath from which to retrieve the value of the variable.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>RoleInstanceValue</languageKeyword> element specifies the xPath from which to retrieve the value of the variable.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>RoleInstanceValue</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>RoleInstanceValue</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: Location path of deployment settings for the instance.
trans-unit.target: Location path of deployment settings for the instance.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f0aa895b-6910-45b7-bc6b-f0fd0d4c8fa0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">xPath Values in Azure</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f0aa895b-6910-45b7-bc6b-f0fd0d4c8fa0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">xPath Values in Azure</link>.

trans-unit.source: You must include either a value attribute or a <languageKeyword>RoleInstanceValue</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: You must include either a value attribute or a <languageKeyword>RoleInstanceValue</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>EntryPoint</languageKeyword> element specifies the entry point for a role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>EntryPoint</languageKeyword> element specifies the entry point for a role.

trans-unit.source: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>NetFxEntryPoint</languageKeyword> elements.
trans-unit.target: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>NetFxEntryPoint</languageKeyword> elements.

trans-unit.source: These elements allow you to specify an application other than the default WaWorkerHost.exe to act as the role entry point.
trans-unit.target: These elements allow you to specify an application other than the default WaWorkerHost.exe to act as the role entry point.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>EntryPoint</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.5 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>EntryPoint</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.5 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>NetFxEntryPoint</languageKeyword> element specifies the program to run for a role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>NetFxEntryPoint</languageKeyword> element specifies the program to run for a role.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>NetFxEntryPoint</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.5 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>NetFxEntryPoint</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.5 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>NetFxEntryPoint</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>NetFxEntryPoint</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The path and file name of the assembly containing the entry point.
trans-unit.target: The path and file name of the assembly containing the entry point.

trans-unit.source: The path is relative to the folder <ui>\%ROLEROOT%\Approot</ui> (do not specify <ui>\%ROLEROOT%\Approot</ui> in <languageKeyword>commandLine</languageKeyword>, it is assumed).
trans-unit.target: The path is relative to the folder <ui>\%ROLEROOT%\Approot</ui> (do not specify <ui>\%ROLEROOT%\Approot</ui> in <languageKeyword>commandLine</languageKeyword>, it is assumed).

trans-unit.source: <ui>%ROLEROOT%</ui> is an environment variable maintained by <token>azure_2</token> and it represents the root folder location for your role.
trans-unit.target: <ui>%ROLEROOT%</ui> is an environment variable maintained by <token>azure_2</token> and it represents the root folder location for your role.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>\%ROLEROOT%\Approot</ui> folder represents the application folder for your role.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>\%ROLEROOT%\Approot</ui> folder represents the application folder for your role.

trans-unit.source: For HWC roles the path is always relative to the <ui>\%ROLEROOT%\Approot\bin</ui> folder.
trans-unit.target: For HWC roles the path is always relative to the <ui>\%ROLEROOT%\Approot\bin</ui> folder.

trans-unit.source: For full IIS and IIS Express web roles, if the assembly cannot be found relative to <ui>\%ROLEROOT%\Approot</ui> folder, the <ui>\%ROLEROOT%\Approot\bin</ui> is searched.
trans-unit.target: For full IIS and IIS Express web roles, if the assembly cannot be found relative to <ui>\%ROLEROOT%\Approot</ui> folder, the <ui>\%ROLEROOT%\Approot\bin</ui> is searched.

trans-unit.source: This fall back behavior for full IIS is not a recommend best practice and maybe removed in future versions.
trans-unit.target: This fall back behavior for full IIS is not a recommend best practice and maybe removed in future versions.

trans-unit.source: The version of the .NET framework on which the assembly was built.
trans-unit.target: The version of the .NET framework on which the assembly was built.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Sites</languageKeyword> element describes a collection of websites and web applications that are hosted in a web role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Sites</languageKeyword> element describes a collection of websites and web applications that are hosted in a web role.

trans-unit.source: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Site</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Site</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify a <languageKeyword>Sites</languageKeyword> element, your web role is hosted as legacy web role and you can only have one website hosted in your web role.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify a <languageKeyword>Sites</languageKeyword> element, your web role is hosted as legacy web role and you can only have one website hosted in your web role.

trans-unit.source: For more information about configuring the Sites element, see <legacyLink xlink:href="e948d01b-eb5a-4332-93fc-f3c9fdad9a6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure a Web Role for Multiple Web Sites</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about configuring the Sites element, see <legacyLink xlink:href="e948d01b-eb5a-4332-93fc-f3c9fdad9a6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure a Web Role for Multiple Web Sites</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: This element is optional and a role can have only one sites block.
trans-unit.target: This element is optional and a role can have only one sites block.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Sites</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Sites</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Site</languageKeyword> element specifies a website or web application that is part of the web role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Site</languageKeyword> element specifies a website or web application that is part of the web role.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Site</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Site</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Site</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Site</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: Name of the website or application.
trans-unit.target: Name of the website or application.

trans-unit.source: The location of the content directory for the site root.
trans-unit.target: The location of the content directory for the site root.

trans-unit.source: The location can be specified as an absolute path or relative to the .csdef location.
trans-unit.target: The location can be specified as an absolute path or relative to the .csdef location.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>VirtualApplication</languageKeyword> element defines an application in Internet Information Services (IIS) 7 is a grouping of files that delivers content or provides services over protocols, such as HTTP.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>VirtualApplication</languageKeyword> element defines an application in Internet Information Services (IIS) 7 is a grouping of files that delivers content or provides services over protocols, such as HTTP.

trans-unit.source: When you create an application in IIS 7, the application's path becomes part of the site's URL.
trans-unit.target: When you create an application in IIS 7, the application's path becomes part of the site's URL.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>VirtualApplication</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>VirtualApplication</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>VirtualApplication</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>VirtualApplication</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a name to identify the virtual application.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a name to identify the virtual application.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the path on the development machine that contains the virtual application.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the path on the development machine that contains the virtual application.

trans-unit.source: In the compute emulator, IIS is configured to retrieve content from this location.
trans-unit.target: In the compute emulator, IIS is configured to retrieve content from this location.

trans-unit.source: When deploying to the Azure, the contents of the physical directory are packaged along with the rest of the service.
trans-unit.target: When deploying to the Azure, the contents of the physical directory are packaged along with the rest of the service.

trans-unit.source: When the service package is deployed to Azure, IIS is configured with the location of the unpacked contents.
trans-unit.target: When the service package is deployed to Azure, IIS is configured with the location of the unpacked contents.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>VirtualDirectory</languageKeyword> element specifies a directory name (also referred to as path) that you specify in IIS and map to a physical directory on a local or remote server.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>VirtualDirectory</languageKeyword> element specifies a directory name (also referred to as path) that you specify in IIS and map to a physical directory on a local or remote server.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>VirtualDirectory</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>VirtualDirectory</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>VirtualDirectory</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>VirtualDirectory</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a name to identify the virtual directory.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a name to identify the virtual directory.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the path on the development machine that contains the website or Virtual directory contents.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the path on the development machine that contains the website or Virtual directory contents.

trans-unit.source: In the compute emulator, IIS is configured to retrieve content from this location.
trans-unit.target: In the compute emulator, IIS is configured to retrieve content from this location.

trans-unit.source: When deploying to the Azure, the contents of the physical directory are packaged along with the rest of the service.
trans-unit.target: When deploying to the Azure, the contents of the physical directory are packaged along with the rest of the service.

trans-unit.source: When the service package is deployed to Azure, IIS is configured with the location of the unpacked contents.
trans-unit.target: When the service package is deployed to Azure, IIS is configured with the location of the unpacked contents.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Bindings</languageKeyword> element describes a collection of bindings for a website.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Bindings</languageKeyword> element describes a collection of bindings for a website.

trans-unit.source: It is the parent element of the <languageKeyword>Binding</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: It is the parent element of the <languageKeyword>Binding</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The element is required for every <languageKeyword>Site</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The element is required for every <languageKeyword>Site</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: For more information about configuring endpoints, see <legacyLink xlink:href="f22fdf50-4e5d-458b-b7a7-68247d951f66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Enable Communication for Role Instances in Azure</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about configuring endpoints, see <legacyLink xlink:href="f22fdf50-4e5d-458b-b7a7-68247d951f66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Enable Communication for Role Instances in Azure</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Bindings</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Bindings</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Binding</languageKeyword> element specifies configuration information required for requests to communicate with a website or web application.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Binding</languageKeyword> element specifies configuration information required for requests to communicate with a website or web application.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Binding</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Binding</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a name to identify the binding.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a name to identify the binding.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the endpoint name to bind to.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the endpoint name to bind to.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a host name that allows you to host multiple sites, with different host names, on a single IP Address/Port number combination.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a host name that allows you to host multiple sites, with different host names, on a single IP Address/Port number combination.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Startup</languageKeyword> element describes a collection of tasks that run when the role is started.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Startup</languageKeyword> element describes a collection of tasks that run when the role is started.

trans-unit.source: This element can be the parent of the <languageKeyword>Variable</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: This element can be the parent of the <languageKeyword>Variable</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using the role startup tasks, see <legacyLink xlink:href="9845a658-6a1c-47a1-95d1-4798864cc55a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure IIS Components in Azure</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about using the role startup tasks, see <legacyLink xlink:href="9845a658-6a1c-47a1-95d1-4798864cc55a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure IIS Components in Azure</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: This element is optional and a role can have only one startup block.
trans-unit.target: This element is optional and a role can have only one startup block.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attribute of the <languageKeyword>Startup</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attribute of the <languageKeyword>Startup</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Task</languageKeyword> element specifies startup task that takes place when the role starts.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Task</languageKeyword> element specifies startup task that takes place when the role starts.

trans-unit.source: Startup tasks can be used to perform tasks that prepare the role to run such install software components or run other applications.
trans-unit.target: Startup tasks can be used to perform tasks that prepare the role to run such install software components or run other applications.

trans-unit.source: Tasks execute in the order in which they appear within the <languageKeyword>Startup</languageKeyword> element block.
trans-unit.target: Tasks execute in the order in which they appear within the <languageKeyword>Startup</languageKeyword> element block.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Task</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Task</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Task</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Task</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: A script, such as a CMD file, containing the commands to run.
trans-unit.target: A script, such as a CMD file, containing the commands to run.

trans-unit.source: Startup command and batch files must be saved in ANSI format.
trans-unit.target: Startup command and batch files must be saved in ANSI format.

trans-unit.source: File formats that set a byte-order marker at the start of the file will not process properly.
trans-unit.target: File formats that set a byte-order marker at the start of the file will not process properly.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the context in which the script is run.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the context in which the script is run.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>limited</languageKeyword> [Default] – Run with the same privileges as the role hosting the process.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>limited</languageKeyword> [Default] – Run with the same privileges as the role hosting the process.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the execution behavior of the command.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the execution behavior of the command.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>simple</languageKeyword> [Default] – System waits for the task to exit before any other tasks are launched.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>simple</languageKeyword> [Default] – System waits for the task to exit before any other tasks are launched.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>background</languageKeyword> – System does not wait for the task to exit.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>background</languageKeyword> – System does not wait for the task to exit.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>foreground</languageKeyword> – Similar to background, except role is not restarted until all foreground tasks exit.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>foreground</languageKeyword> – Similar to background, except role is not restarted until all foreground tasks exit.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Contents</languageKeyword> element describes the collection of content for a web role.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Contents</languageKeyword> element describes the collection of content for a web role.

trans-unit.source: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Content</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: This element is the parent of the <languageKeyword>Content</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Contents</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.5 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Contents</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.5 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Content</languageKeyword> element defines the source location of content to be copied to the <token>azure_2</token> virtual machine and the destination path to which it is copied.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Content</languageKeyword> element defines the source location of content to be copied to the <token>azure_2</token> virtual machine and the destination path to which it is copied.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Content</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.5 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Content</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.5 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Content</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>Content</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: Location on the <token>azure_2</token> virtual machine to which the content is placed.
trans-unit.target: Location on the <token>azure_2</token> virtual machine to which the content is placed.

trans-unit.source: This location is relative to the folder <ui>%ROLEROOT%\Approot</ui>.
trans-unit.target: This location is relative to the folder <ui>%ROLEROOT%\Approot</ui>.

trans-unit.source: This element is the parent element of the <languageKeyword>SourceDirectory</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: This element is the parent element of the <languageKeyword>SourceDirectory</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>SourceDirectory</languageKeyword> element defines the local directory from which content is copied.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>SourceDirectory</languageKeyword> element defines the local directory from which content is copied.

trans-unit.source: Use this element to specify the local contents to copy to the <token>azure_2</token> virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Use this element to specify the local contents to copy to the <token>azure_2</token> virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>SourceDirectory</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.5 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>SourceDirectory</languageKeyword> element is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.5 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>SourceDirectory</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>SourceDirectory</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: Relative or absolute path of a local directory whose contents will be copied to the <token>azure_2</token> virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Relative or absolute path of a local directory whose contents will be copied to the <token>azure_2</token> virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Expansion of environment variables in the directory path is supported.
trans-unit.target: Expansion of environment variables in the directory path is supported.
